FRS_Method: GPS CODE (PSEUDO RANGE) STANDARD POSITION (SA OFF)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
WHITE CLOUD GRAIN CO., INC. IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS WHICH SELLS ANHYDROUS AMMONIA TO AREA CROP PRODUCERS. THIS FACILITY HAS TWO 18,000 GALLON TANKS WITH A TOTAL CAPACITY OF 169,000 POUNDS. THESE TANKS ARE DESIGNED AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ALL APPLICABLE LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTES OUR TANKS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH ALL OF THEIR REQUEST FOR IMPROVEMENTS.

THE WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD HAVE A TOXIC GAS RELEASE OF 143,000 POUNDS OF AMMONIA WITH A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF 2.50 MILES AFFECTING APPROXIMATELY 10 AREA CITIZENS. THE ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO WOULD RELEASE 11,908 LBS. OF AMMONIA THROUGH THE TRANSFER HOSE AND WOULD HAVE A DISTANCE TO ENDPOINT OF .41 MILES. THIS RELEASE WOULD HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO AFFECT APPROXIMATELY 10 PEOPLE.

THIS COMPANY'S POLICY HAS BEEN TO TRAIN EMPLOYEES IN THE SAFE HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA ON A REGULAR BASIS. THE EMPLOYEES WHO WORK IN THE AMMONIA PLANT ARE TRAINED IN THE SAFETY INFORMATION, HAZARDS, OPERATING PROCEDURES AND THE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES OF THE TYPICAL FACILITY. THE EMPLOYEES ALWAYS WEAR GOGGLES AND THE APPROPRIATE GLOVES WHILE FILLING NURSE TANKS. ABOVE ALL, THEY MAKE SURE TO HAVE CLEAN SAFETY WATER ON HAND DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS. OUR SAFETY RECORD ALLOWS US TO PROUDLY REPORT THAT THERE HAVE BEEN NO INJURY ACCIDENTS AT THIS POINT  AT ANY OF OUR LOCATION IN THE LAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN IS SHARED WITH OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, THEY ARE AWARE OF THE DANGERS OF ANHYROUS AMMONIA. THEY'VE ALSO, AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY
